ygData.subject: Re:[cantera] cantera matlab toolbox
ygData.msgSnippet: Mister Goodwin, Thank you very much for your answer. Last time, I read a pdf explaining the paricularities of each Cantera version (Python, Matlab, C++, ...)

Mister Goodwin,
Thank you very much for your answer.
Last time, I read a pdf explaining the paricularities of each Cantera vers=
ion (Python, Matlab, C++, ...) and I understood that for one dimensional fl=
ame simulation like I want to do, it is, for the moment, ONLY possible with=
 the Python version. So, I suppose that I must first install my Linux OS be=
for Python Cantera because these may not be possible under any Windows (?).
What do you think about modelling the combustion flame of solid propellant=
s. Could it be easy ?
With best regards,
Mathiew

---------- Initial Header -----------

From      : "Dave Goodwin" <dgoodwin@...>
To          : cantera@yahoogroups.com
Cc          :=20
Date      : Thu, 01 May 2003 00:00:49 -0000
Subject : [cantera] cantera matlab toolbox

Mathiew,

I think there is a README file that explains what to do.  I know
there is in the source=20
distribution, but I might have left it out of the Windows installer.

In any case, run Cantera14.msi, then you will have a folder named
Cantera, and within=20
that should be a folder named Matlab. In there is a zip file that is
the Matlab toolbox.=20
Unzip it, start Matlab, and add it to the Matlab  path.

It is possible if you are running Windows 98 that your system does
not have the=20
Windows Installer, which you need to run .msi files.  If it doesn't
run, go to the=20
Microsoft web site and search for 'Windows Installer'.
(This is standard on Windows 2000 or later, and is also installed
automatically if you=20
install Microsoft Office 2000 on older systems.)

Hope this helps.

Dave Goodwin


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "mathieu.winger1@l..."
<mathieu.winger1@l...>=20
wrote:
> Dr Goodwin,
> Download is OK. I don't know how to continue with runing Cantera
under Matlab/
Windows98. How must I proceed with makefiles ? Please, some
explanations will be=20
welcome.
> Thank you very much.
> Mathiew=20
>=20
>=20

> Subject : Re: [cantera] Cantera 1.4 -- corrected URL
>=20
> Here's the corrected SourceForge URL:
>=20
> http://sourceforge.net/projects/cantera
>=20
>=20
>=20
> On Monday, April 21, 2003, at 07:16 AM, David Goodwin wrote:
>=20
> > Cantera 1.4 has been released.
> >
> > What's new:
> >
> > 1. Simplified unix build procedure. Cantera should build 'out of
the
> > box' on linux, cygwin, Mac OS X, and Solaris. If you have Python
and/or
> > MATLAB installed, the appropriate interface will be built and
installed
> > automatically. You can choose the installation directory.
> >
> > 2. As of this release, Cantera is now hosted by SourceForge at
> > http://sourceforge.net/projects/cantera. You can access the
current
> > version of the source through the read-only CVS server, or
download the
> > latest release as a tar.gz archive.
> >
> > 3. Fortran 77 support.  A complete example is included of using
Cantera
> > from Fortran 77. See file 'f77.doc' in the 'cantera documentation'
> > package at the SourceForge site.
> >
> > A Windows version will be released shortly.
> >
> > Please report bugs, comments, suggestions, etc. either here or
> > (preferably) through the SourceForge Cantera site.
> >
